name: Blair Drummond Smiddy Farm Shop
description:
**Blair Drummond Smiddy Farm Shop: Where Fresh, Local Bounty Meets Unforgettable Scottish Views.**  

Nestled in the heart of Blair Drummond, Stirling, **Blair Drummond Smiddy Farm Shop** is more than a farm shop—it’s a celebration of Scotland’s finest seasonal produce, served with a side of breathtaking Gargunnock Hills vistas. Here, tradition meets taste, and every visit feels like coming home.  

Born from a deep respect for the land, the Smiddy Farm Shop champions local farmers and artisans, offering **premium meats, fresh groceries, and ready-made meals** that tell the story of Stirling’s rich agricultural heritage. This isn’t just shopping—it’s an experience. The rustic charm of the shop, paired with the warmth of its team, makes every purchase feel personal.  

Step inside and discover shelves lined with **handpicked, seasonal produce**, each item a testament to quality and sustainability. Stay for a while in the on-site café, where hearty, locally sourced dishes are served daily from 9am to 5pm (hot food until 4pm). Whether you’re sipping coffee with a view or stocking up on farm-fresh essentials, every moment here is designed to delight.  

As we bid farewell to online orders, we’re doubling down on what we do best: **welcoming you in person**. Because food tastes better when it’s shared—and the Smiddy’s story is best told face-to-face.  

Come for the **best farm shop in Stirling**. Stay for the flavours, the views, and the feeling of connection. Your table—and the hills—are waiting.

name: Barnhill Farmshop
description:
**Barnhill Farmshop: Where Nature Nourishes and Community Grows**  

At Barnhill Farmshop, the freshest flavors of Renfrewshire meet the warmth of a working farm. Nestled on 70 acres along the River Gryfe in Inchinnan, this family-run haven is more than a farm shop—it’s a celebration of honest food, crafted with care and served with pride.  

For generations, Barnhill Farm has been rooted in the land, blending tradition with a modern commitment to sustainability. Today, their farm shop brims with seasonal produce, handpicked from local growers and artisans. Think crusty, oven-fresh bread, grass-fed butchery cuts, and creamy, small-batch ice cream—all served under one roof. The café buzzes with the hum of conversation, while kids explore the indoor and outdoor play areas, free to roam as nature intended.  

What sets Barnhill apart? **Connection.** Every jar of preserves, every cut of meat, tells the story of a nearby field or a neighbor’s craft. The shop’s rustic charm belies its meticulous curation: here, "local" isn’t a label—it’s a promise. Visitors don’t just shop; they taste the difference of soil, sun, and care.  

Open year-round, the farm invites you to slow down. Sip coffee by the river, let the kids run wild, and leave with a basket full of Renfrewshire’s best. Because at Barnhill, good food isn’t just grown—it’s shared.  

**Come taste the season. Come feed the soul.**  

*(Farm shop in Renfrewshire | Fresh seasonal produce | Family-friendly café | Sustainable local food)*

name: Greenhall Country Cafe & Farm Shop
description:
**Scotland’s Finest Wagyu Starts Here.**  

At **Greenhall Country Cafe & Farm Shop** on Hamilton Road in South Lanarkshire, we don’t just sell beef—we redefine it. Since 2016, we’ve been home to Scotland’s first dedicated **Wagyu Shop**, raising and crafting this legendary Japanese beef right here in our fields. No middlemen, no shortcuts—just **premium Scottish Wagyu and Angus beef**, pasture-to-plate, with the care only a local farm can deliver.  

Our story is simple: **quality over everything**. Registered with the **British Wagyu Association**, we’re pioneers in bringing this globally celebrated meat to Scotland. Wagyu, renowned for its rich marbling and buttery tenderness, is a cut above—and ours is born, reared, and hand-selected on our land. Alongside our **Scottish lamb** and farm shop offerings, every product reflects our commitment to **fresh, local, and exceptional** produce.  

Step into our **farm shop in South Lanarkshire**, and you’ll find more than groceries—you’ll discover a **curated experience**. Shelves lined with **seasonal, artisan goods**, the scent of freshly baked bread, and the pride of knowing exactly where your food comes from. Whether you’re a chef seeking the **finest Wagyu in Scotland** or a family stocking up on **honest, high-quality ingredients**, Greenhall delivers.  

Come taste the difference. Visit us at **G72 9UD**—where tradition meets luxury, and every bite tells a story.

name: Ardardan Estate
description:
**Ardardan Estate: Where Scottish Farmland Meets Uncompromising Quality**  

Nestled in the lush landscapes of Cardross, Argyll and Bute, **Ardardan Estate** is more than a farm—it’s a celebration of heritage, flavor, and the rhythms of the land. For generations, this working estate has been a cornerstone of local agriculture, now reimagined as a destination where tradition meets modern craftsmanship.  

Step into the **farm shop at Ardardan Estate**, and you’ll find shelves lined with **fresh, seasonal produce**—each item a testament to Scotland’s rich terroir. From artisanal cheeses to hand-picked vegetables, every product tells a story of care, from soil to shelf. The shop itself is a reflection of the estate’s ethos: unpretentious yet elegant, where quality speaks for itself.  

But Ardardan isn’t just a place to shop—it’s an experience. Wander through the grounds, taste the difference in every bite, and connect with the hands that cultivate the land. The estate’s **cheese-tasting evenings** are a must for food lovers, offering a chance to savor flavors as rich as Ardardan’s history.  

Open seven days a week (hours vary—check **Monty’s website** for details), the farm invites you to slow down, explore, and indulge. Follow their journey on Instagram **@Ardardanestate**, where rolling fields and bustling markets come to life.  

Come for the produce. Stay for the passion. **Ardardan Estate** is waiting.

name: Edenmill Farm - Cafe, Soft Play & Accomodation
The Woodhouse Kippen
description:
**The Woodhouse Kippen: Where Farm-Fresh Meets Unforgettable Flavour**  

Just outside the historic village of Kippen in rural Stirlingshire, The Woodhouse Kippen is more than a farm shop—it’s a celebration of local abundance, served with warmth and flair. Since 2012, this beloved destination has been a cornerstone of the community, offering fresh seasonal produce, artisanal delights, and a café experience that turns meals into memories.  

Step inside, and you’ll discover a farm shop in Stirling that’s brimming with the best of the region: crisp vegetables, handcrafted cheeses, and pantry staples with provenance. But the real magic happens in the bustling café, where every dish tells a story. Sink your teeth into the twice-baked cheese soufflé—light, golden, and impossibly rich. Or indulge in the legendary Woodhouse mac & cheese, a creamy homage to comfort. The brie, bacon & cranberry toastie? A symphony of sweet, salty, and savoury, perfected over years of devotion.  

Beyond the plate, The Woodhouse Kippen thrives as a gathering place. Join the Hoofgang for children’s story time, browse the Summer Market for handpicked bargains, or simply linger over a coffee as the Scottish countryside unfolds outside. Every visit feels like coming home.  

Open for lunch, laden with flavour, and alive with charm—this is farm-fresh, reimagined. Come taste the difference.  

*(Opening times and visitor details available at the farm shop.)*

name: Ayrshire Food Hub
description:
**Ayrshire Food Hub: Where Fresh, Local Flavor Meets Scottish Heartland**  

At the crossroads of tradition and innovation, Ayrshire Food Hub celebrates the best of Scotland’s fertile west. Nestled just outside Hurlford (East Ayrshire Council KA1 5JQ), this isn’t just a farm shop—it’s a vibrant gathering place where soil-to-table goodness meets community spirit.  

Rooted in Ayrshire’s rich agricultural heritage, the Hub is a testament to local pride. Here, the story is simple: *Ayrshire food from Ayrshire folk*. From the development kitchen crafting seasonal delights to the growing garden bursting with fresh ingredients, every corner reflects a commitment to cutting food miles and supporting nearby producers. The farm shop is the heartbeat of it all—a curated selection of the region’s finest, from crisp vegetables to artisan goods, all delivered with the warmth of a neighbor’s welcome.  

Step inside, and the experience unfolds. The air hums with the scent of just-baked bread and ripe produce. Whether you’re stocking your pantry or pausing for coffee in the café, every visit feels like a celebration of what grows here.

Every apple, every loaf, every jar tells a story of partnerships with trusted growers, ensuring your table is graced with flavor at its peak. The shop’s charm lies in its simplicity: unpretentious, yet uncompromising. This is food as it should be—honest, vibrant, and deeply connected to the land.

At **L S Smellie & Sons Ltd**, farming isn’t just a business—it’s a 150-year story of soil, sweat, and stewardship. Nestled in the rolling hills of **South Lanarkshire** near Strathaven, this family-run farm blends heritage with innovation, offering **fresh local produce** and **finest feed blends** for healthy livestock. Here, tradition meets tomorrow.

This is farming as it should be: honest, flavorful, and forward-looking. **Visit the farm shop in South Lanarkshire**—where every bite tells a story, and the next chapter begins with you. Taste the difference time makes.

name: The ELF Bothy at East Lugtonridge Farm
description:
**The ELF Bothy: Where Tradition Meets Exceptional Taste in North Ayrshire**  

At East Lugtonridge Farm, we believe the best flavors are grown slowly, with care—just as nature intended.  

Welcome to **The ELF Bothy**, a family-run farm in Burnhouse, North Ayrshire, where heritage and quality converge. Established in 2013, we’re dedicated to reviving rare native cattle breeds and traditional farming methods—crafting meat with unmatched depth, marbling, and flavor. Here, time-honored practices meet a commitment to excellence, delivering produce that’s as exceptional as the land it comes from.  

Step into our **farm shop in North Ayrshire Council**, and you’ll find the heart of our work: **fresh, seasonal produce** grown and reared with patience and pride. Our shelves are stocked with the finest cuts from our native cattle, each raised slowly to develop rich, distinctive taste. This isn’t just meat—it’s a celebration of Scotland’s agricultural legacy, brought to your table.  

But The ELF Bothy is more than a farm shop—it’s an experience. Every visit connects you to the rhythms of the land, the care of our family, and the authenticity of **local, sustainable farming**. Whether you’re seeking premium ingredients or simply a taste of rural tradition, you’ll leave with more than a purchase—you’ll take home a piece of our story.  

Come see—and taste—the difference for yourself. Visit us at East Lugtonridge Farm, where every bite tells a story of passion, patience, and place.

Open year-round, Fencebay Fisheries is more than a stop; it’s a sensory journey. Come for the smokey aroma of oak-cured salmon, stay for the warmth of a team passionate about their craft. Whether you’re stocking your kitchen or savoring a meal at their acclaimed restaurant, this is coastal Scotland at its most delicious.  

**Visit the farm shop in North Ayrshire. Taste the difference tradition makes.**

name: Rootin' and Roamin'
description:
**Rootin’ and Roamin’: Where Rare Breeds Roam Free, and Flavour Thrives**  

At Rootin’ and Roamin’, we believe the best meat starts with respect—for the animal, the land, and the plate. Nestled in the rolling hills of Kinross-shire, our family farm is a sanctuary for rare-breed pigs and heritage cattle, where slow, ethical farming meets exceptional flavour.  

Founded in 2018, Rootin’ and Roamin’ began with a simple mission: to revive traditional farming methods while championing minority breeds. Our free-range Gloucester Old Spot and Saddleback pigs root and roam as nature intended, while our pedigree Dexter and Kerry cattle graze on lush Scottish pasture. The result? Pork and beef with unmatched depth, texture, and taste—all harvested with care.  

Step into our farm shop in Perth and Kinross, and you’ll find more than just fresh local produce. You’ll discover a curated selection of hand-cut meats, seasonal staples, and artisan goods—all grown, raised, or sourced with the same integrity we apply to our own fields. Every cut tells a story of patience, passion, and the unspoiled beauty of rural Scotland.  

We invite you to taste the difference time makes. Visit our farm shop, meet the animals, and take home a piece of Kinross-shire’s finest. Because great food isn’t just made—it’s earned.  

**Rootin’ and Roamin’ Farm Shop**  
Hardiston Farm, Perth and Kinross  
Fresh. Ethical. Uncompromising.

Visit. Taste. Stay a while. Ardardan Walled Garden Nursery isn’t just a place—it’s a reminder of how good food should feel. Open seven days a week (hours vary—check Monty’s website for details). Your table is waiting.

Here, the land yields more than crops—it produces **award-winning "single malt" meats**, from rich venison to tender lamb and grass-fed beef, each cut a testament to time-honored care.  

Step into the **Carmichael Farm Shop**, and you’ll find more than fresh local produce—you’ll discover a **curated taste of Scotland**. But the experience doesn’t end at the till. Stay in one of the estate’s **12 luxury self-catering cottages**, where modern comfort meets rustic charm. Wake to the quiet hum of the countryside, explore scenic trails, then return to a kitchen stocked with Carmichael’s finest—because here, even a holiday meal is a connection to the land.  

Open year-round, the farm shop invites you to **taste history, not just hear it**. Whether you’re stocking your pantry or seeking a retreat, Carmichael Estate offers something rare: **a slice of Scotland’s soul, served fresh**.  

Visit us at the **Carmichael Visitor Centre**, where every bite tells a story.

name: Thorneybank Farm Shop
description:
**Thorneybank Farm Shop: Where Generations Grow Goodness**  

Since the 1970s, Thorneybank Farm Shop has been a quiet Aberdeenshire secret—a place where the soil’s richness meets the care of skilled hands. Nestled in Lower Thorneybank, this family-run farm shop delivers the freshest local produce, picked daily and baked with pride. Here, three generations of the Stephen family work side by side, turning tradition into something you can taste.  

Walk in, and you’ll find shelves lined with vegetables pulled straight from the field, their vibrancy a testament to Aberdeenshire’s fertile land. Catherine Stephen’s legendary shortbread—crisp, buttery, and meltingly tender—has earned a global following, yet it’s made just as it always has been: in-house, with patience and precision. Every loaf, every pastry, every crisp apple reflects a simple truth: when food is grown and prepared by those who love it, quality speaks for itself.  

Thorneybank isn’t just a farm shop; it’s a living legacy. The rhythm of planting and harvest guides their days, and that connection to the land shines in every product they offer. Visitors don’t just buy groceries—they take home a piece of Aberdeenshire’s heart, wrapped in paper or piled into baskets.  

Come for the freshest seasonal produce in the region. Stay for the warmth of a family who knows that good food begins with respect—for the soil, the craft, and the people they serve. Open daily. Taste the difference generations make.

name: Marshall's Farm Shop
description:

At Marshall’s Farm Shop, every bite tells a story of soil, season, and Scottish tradition.

What began as a humble family farm has blossomed into a destination for discerning food lovers, now home to a beautifully curated farm shop, a warm fireside bothy, and a kitchen brimming with homemade delights. Step inside, and the scent of freshly baked bread greets you—a testament to the new on-site bakery, where loaves and cakes emerge golden from the oven daily. Shelves are stocked with the finest seasonal produce from Aberdeenshire’s trusted growers, alongside indulgent desserts and pantry staples that elevate every meal. The shop’s design balances rustic authenticity with clean, inviting simplicity—a reflection of Apple’s elegance, applied to the heart of farm life.  

But Marshall’s is more than a place to shop; it’s a place to linger. Let your dog roam free in the newly opened muddy paws fields, then unwind in the fireside bothy with a coffee and a slice of cake. Every detail—from the handpicked local suppliers to the warm, knowledgeable staff—speaks to a commitment to community and quality.  

Come taste the difference at Marshall’s Farm Shop. Where the land’s goodness is served with generosity, and every visit feels like coming home.

name: Forest Farm The Organic Dairy
description:
**Pure. Organic. Uncompromising.**  

At **Forest Farm The Organic Dairy**, Scotland’s oldest organic dairy, every drop of milk and every bite of cheese tells a story of tradition, care, and the lush pastures of Kinellar, Aberdeenshire. Here, happy cows roam freely, grazing on rich, chemical-free grass—just as nature intended. The result? Artisan dairy products so pure, they’re a taste of the land itself.  

Founded on a legacy of sustainability, Forest Farm has spent generations perfecting the art of organic farming. From **grass to glass, cow to cone**, every step is crafted with respect for the earth and the animals. Their **farm shop in Aberdeenshire** is a treasure trove of **fresh, seasonal produce**, where handcrafted cheeses, creamy yogurts, and velvety ice cream sit alongside locally sourced pantry staples. It’s a celebration of slow food, done right.  

Step inside the farm shop and discover a space where rustic charm meets modern simplicity. Wooden shelves gleam with jars of golden honey, crusty loaves of sourdough, and bottles of cold-pressed juice—all sourced from trusted neighbors. The air hums with the scent of warm milk and wild herbs. This isn’t just shopping; it’s an experience.  

Come for the **organic dairy**, stay for the connection. Taste the difference time, care, and open pastures make. Visit **Forest Farm The Organic Dairy**—where every bite is a return to what’s real.

At Finzean Estate, the land doesn’t just yield food—it tells a story. Today, the shop continues that legacy, offering **fresh seasonal produce** sourced directly from nearby farms and artisans. Every apple, loaf of bread, and jar of preserves tells a story—of hardworking hands, sustainable practices, and a commitment to supporting Aberdeen’s local economy.  

Step inside, and you’ll find more than just groceries. The shop is a celebration of flavour and craftsmanship, where shelves are stocked with the best **farm shop products** Aberdeen has to offer. Whether it’s crisp vegetables, artisan cheeses, or homemade treats, each item is chosen with care. The warmth of the staff and the quality of the goods make every visit feel like coming home.  

Kepplestone Farm Shop isn’t just a stop—it’s an experience. A place where tradition meets taste, and where every purchase supports the community that sustains it.  

**Come for the freshness. Stay for the connection.** Visit us at Kepplestone Farm, Newhills, and taste the difference local makes.

description:
**The Finest Aberdeen Angus, Crafted with Care—Since 2004.**  

At **McGregor Aberdeen Angus Farmshop and Deli**, in the heart of Aberdeenshire’s rolling countryside, quality is never compromised. Here, tradition meets taste: a family-run farm shop dedicated to exceptional beef, hand-selected local produce, and the art of honest, flavourful food.  

It began with a simple mission—to raise the finest pure Aberdeen Angus beef, grass-fed and slow-grown for unmatched richness. Today, that commitment extends beyond the pasture. Step into the **farm shop in Whiterashes**, and you’ll find shelves lined with carefully curated cheeses, wines, and preserves, each chosen to complement the star of the show: McGregor’s own beef. Daily, the kitchen transforms these ingredients into **award-winning steak pies**, freshly baked cakes, and ready meals made with the same pride as the farm’s founding principles.  

This is more than a farm shop—it’s an experience. The scent of warm pastry, the rustle of brown paper wrapping cuts for customers, the quiet hum of a community that values **fresh, seasonal Aberdeenshire produce**. Every detail, from the free-range egg quiches to the hand-tied game, reflects a dedication to craftsmanship.  

Come for the beef. Stay for the warmth of a place where food is still made the right way. Visit **McGregor Aberdeen Angus Farmshop and Deli**—where every bite tells a story.  

*(Opening times and visitor information available at the farm shop.)*

name: Barra Bronzes Free Range Turkeys
description:
**Barra Bronzes: Where Heritage Meets the Finest Free-Range Turkeys in Aberdeenshire**  

For centuries, the art of farming has been woven into the land at Barra Bronzes—a family legacy that delivers seven-time Great Taste award-winning turkeys, raised with patience, pride, and unparalleled care. Nestled in the rolling hills of Lochend of Barra, Aberdeenshire, this farm is a testament to tradition, where every turkey is nurtured the slow, honest way: free-range, hand-plucked, and game-hung for depth of flavor you can taste in every bite.  

Here, turkey farming is a craft. Skilled farmers blend time-honored methods with a deep respect for the land, ensuring each bird thrives on a natural diet and the crisp Scottish air. The result? Exceptional, succulent meat that has earned Barra Bronzes its reputation as a purveyor of the finest free-range turkeys in the UK. But the farm’s commitment to quality doesn’t stop there.  

Step into their charming **farm shop in Aberdeenshire**, and you’ll find a treasure trove of **fresh, seasonal produce**—each item thoughtfully selected to reflect the region’s bounty. From golden-yolked eggs to artisan preserves, every product tells a story of local passion and sustainable farming. The shop itself is a warm, welcoming space, where visitors can connect with the hands that feed them and take home a piece of Barra Bronzes’ heritage.  

Come for the turkeys. Stay for the taste of Aberdeenshire at its very best. Visit us, and experience farming as it was meant to be—honest, unhurried, and unforgettable.

name: Asqu Farm Shop
description:
**"At Asqu Farm Shop, four generations of passion meet the freshest Aberdeenshire harvest."**  

Nestled in the heart of Aberdeenshire at 39 North Street, Asqu Farm Shop is where tradition and innovation unite to bring you the finest local produce. For over a century, our family has worked with the land—honoring time-tested methods while embracing cutting-edge techniques to grow food that’s as wholesome as it is delicious.  

Step into our farm shop, and you’ll taste the difference. Every carrot, every cut of meat, every jar of preserves is grown or crafted with care, ensuring quality that’s healthy for you and gentle on the environment. We blend the best of both worlds: heritage wisdom and modern sustainability, so your plate is filled with flavor you can trust.  

Here, shopping is an experience. The crisp scent of fresh seasonal produce, the warmth of a community hub—it’s a place where food tells a story. Whether you’re stocking up for the week or seeking a taste of Aberdeenshire’s finest, our shelves are stocked with honest, local goodness.  

Visit us and see (and taste) what four generations of dedication can do. Asqu Farm Shop isn’t just a stop—it’s where farm-to-table feels like coming home.  

*Open now at the farm shop—your table starts here.*

name: The Flower Field
description:
**The Flower Field: Where Aberdeenshire’s Finest Produce Grows**  

At the heart of Scotland’s fertile farmlands, **The Flower Field** has been a cornerstone of Aberdeenshire agriculture for generations. Located just off the A90 near Inverbervie, this family-run farm blends tradition with modern craftsmanship, delivering exceptional seed potatoes, cereals, oilseed rape (OSR), and daffodil bulbs to fields and gardens across the country. But step beyond the fields, and you’ll find something just as remarkable: a farm shop brimming with fresh, local produce—where every visit feels like a celebration of the land.  

**Rooted in Heritage, Grown for Today**  
The Flower Field’s legacy is built on expertise—each crop nurtured with care, each harvest a testament to Aberdeenshire’s rich soil. From golden daffodil bulbs that herald spring to robust seed potatoes trusted by growers nationwide, the farm’s offerings are as practical as they are poetic. Yet the true magic lies in their **farm shop**, a curated showcase of seasonal flavours. Here, you’ll find the best of the region: crisp vegetables, artisan staples, and pantry essentials—all grown or sourced with unwavering standards.  

**A Destination for the Discerning**  
The shop itself is a reflection of the farm’s ethos: unpretentious, elegant, and deeply connected to the community. Whether you’re a local cook seeking the freshest ingredients or a visitor craving an authentic taste of rural Scotland, The Flower Field welcomes you. Opening times are posted at the shop—no reservations needed, just an appetite for quality.  

**Come for the produce. Stay for the passion.**  
Visit The Flower Field on the A90, and take home more than just groceries—take home a piece of Aberdeenshire’s bounty.

name: Farm Stop
description:
**Escape. Explore. Taste the Good Life at Farm Stop.**  

Just 10 minutes from Aberdeen, where the Aberdeenshire coastline meets rolling farmland, you’ll find **Farm Stop**—a family-run sanctuary of fresh flavors and hands-on discovery. This award-winning farm isn’t just a place; it’s an experience. Here, the rhythm of the seasons guides everything, from the crisp produce in the farm shop to the laughter of visitors feeding lambs or picking sun-warmed berries.  

For generations, this land has been tended with care. Today, that legacy lives on in **Farm Stop’s commitment to fresh, local, and seasonal**—whether it’s grass-fed meats, just-laid eggs, or artisan preserves lining the shelves of their charming farm shop. Every product tells a story of soil, sunshine, and meticulous craftsmanship.  

But what truly sets Farm Stop apart? **Connection.** This isn’t a passive visit; it’s an invitation to roll up your sleeves. Feed the goats, taste honey straight from the hive, or chat with the farmers who know each carrot by name. (Just remember: **all visits are pre-booked**—because quality time, like good food, shouldn’t be rushed.)  

The farm shop is a treasure trove of Aberdeenshire’s finest: think golden rapeseed oil, heather-scented honey, and crusty loaves baked with heritage grains. It’s a celebration of **slow food, fast joy**.  

So leave the hustle behind. Let the salty coastal air mix with the scent of fresh bread as you wander. **Come hungry. Leave inspired.**  

*Farm Stop: Where the land feeds the soul.*  

*(Pre-book your visit today. Farm shop open daily—check website for seasonal hours.)*  

📍 Farm Stop, Portlethen, Aberdeenshire | **Your escape starts here.**

name: Wynford Farm Park
description:
**Wynford Farm Park: Where Aberdeen’s Countryside Comes Alive.**  

Just minutes from Aberdeen City, Wynford Farm Park is more than a farm—it’s an escape. A place where rolling fields meet family adventure, and the freshest local produce fills our farm shop. Here, the rhythm of the land is woven into every experience, from animal encounters in our enchanted forest to the crisp bite of just-picked seasonal goods.  

For generations, Wynford has been a cornerstone of Kingswells’ countryside, blending working farmland with joyful discovery. Today, our farm shop stands as a testament to that legacy: a curated selection of fresh, local produce, from artisan cheeses to sun-ripened fruits, all sourced with care. But this is no ordinary farm shop in Aberdeen City—it’s a celebration of the region’s bounty, designed to connect you to the land and the hands that nurture it.  

Visitors come for the animals—adorable, exotic, and always eager to greet you—but stay for the magic of the outdoors. Wander through our enchanted forest, try your hand at seasonal animal handling, or simply breathe in the crisp Scottish air. Every corner of Wynford is crafted to feel both timeless and alive, a harmony of heritage and modern charm.  

Come taste the difference freshness makes. Explore, savor, and reconnect at Wynford Farm Park—where every visit is a story waiting to unfold.  

*(Opening times and visitor details available at our farm shop.)*

name: Edzell Tweed Warehouse - The Tweedie
description:
**A Taste of Tradition, Served with Scottish Warmth.**  

At **Edzell Tweed Warehouse – The Tweedie**, just north of Brechin in the heart of Angus, you’ll find more than a farm shop—you’ll discover a gathering place where heritage meets hospitality. Nestled on Dunlappie Road, this charming stop invites travelers and locals alike to pause, savor, and connect over the finest local produce Scotland has to offer.  

For generations, The Tweedie has been a cornerstone of the community, blending the rustic charm of a working farm with the welcoming spirit of a village café. Step inside, and the aroma of freshly brewed coffee mingles with the earthy richness of seasonal farm shop products—handpicked fruits, artisan cheeses, and pantry staples crafted with care. Every item tells a story of Angus’s fertile land and the hands that nurture it.  

But this is more than a pit stop; it’s an experience. The farm shop’s shelves are a curated showcase of Scotland’s bounty, while the café serves as a warm refuge for weary explorers. Whether you’re fueling up with a hearty meal or browsing for handcrafted gifts, The Tweedie wraps you in the kind of hospitality that feels like coming home.  

Visit us at **1, Dunlappie Road, Angus DD9 7UB**, and taste the difference tradition makes. Call ahead at **01356 648348**—we’re here to welcome you. Because the best journeys always include a moment to slow down, savor, and share.

name: Aberdeenshire Highland Beef
description:
**Aberdeenshire Highland Beef: Where Tradition Meets the Finest Flavour**  

At Lochton of Leys, the Highlands don’t just surround you—they’re on your plate.  

Aberdeenshire Highland Beef is more than a farm; it’s a legacy. Nestled in the rolling hills of Banchory, this family-run farm raises 100% pure pedigree Highland cattle, renowned for their rich, marbled beef—traditionally hung and matured to perfection. Here, the rhythms of the land shape everything: from the free-roaming herds to the seasonal lambing and sheep shearing experiences that invite you into the heart of Scottish farming.  

Step into their charming farm shop, and you’ll find the essence of Aberdeenshire. Open weekends (8 ’til 8), it’s a haven for those who crave quality. Pre-order your cuts of Highland beef—each slice a testament to slow, ethical farming—or browse their small but curated stock of fresh, local produce. From 3pm on Sundays, the shop welcomes spontaneous visits, offering a taste of the Highlands when you need it most.  

What sets this farm apart? It’s the connection. The shop isn’t just a place to buy; it’s where you meet the hands that reared your food. The cattle graze on open pasture, the lambs are born in view of visitors, and every cut tells a story of care. Sustainability isn’t a trend here—it’s tradition.  

Come for the beef. Stay for the experience. Whether you’re booking a Highland cattle encounter, collecting your weekend order, or simply savouring the freshest flavours of Aberdeenshire, this is farming as it should be: honest, exceptional, and deeply rooted in the land.  

**Visit us at Lochton of Leys, Banchory AB31 5QB. Pre-order online or drop by—the Highlands are waiting.**

name: Louise’s Farm Kitchen
description:
**"At Louise’s Farm Kitchen, the land feeds the table—and the soul."**  

Nestled in the rolling hills of Aboyne, Aberdeenshire, **Louise’s Farm Kitchen** is where honest farming meets modern appetite. Here, the rhythm of the seasons dictates what’s on offer—**fresh, local produce**, reared and grown with care, delivered straight from our fields to your plate.  

This is a farm with roots. What began as a family passion for **naturally good food** has blossomed into a thriving hub for the community. Through **pop-up farm shop days**, bustling **farmers’ markets**, and a **monthly delivery service**, we bridge the gap between soil and supper. Every cut of meat, every jar of preserves, carries the story of Aberdeenshire’s rich, fertile land.  

Step into our **farm shop in Aboyne**, and you’ll find more than just ingredients—you’ll discover a connection. The air hums with the scent of **seasonal produce**, the shelves lined with offerings as thoughtful as they are fresh. It’s a place where food is celebrated, not just sold.  

We believe luxury is simplicity done well. That’s why our **farm-to-fork ethos** isn’t a trend—it’s a tradition. Whether you’re stocking your pantry or seeking the **best local meat in Aberdeenshire**, every visit is a chance to taste the difference care makes.  

Come hungry. Leave nourished. **Louise’s Farm Kitchen**—where good food, and good living, begin.  

*(Ready to experience farm-fresh flavour? Visit our shop or join our newsletter for updates straight from the fields.)*

name: Little Rowater
description:
**Little Rowater: Where Premium Meets Pasture in Aberdeenshire**  

At Little Rowater, we farm with purpose—delivering exceptional local produce straight from the heart of Scotland’s fertile northeast.  

Nestled near Cornhill in Aberdeenshire, Little Rowater is more than a farm; it’s a celebration of heritage, quality, and community. Founded in 2015, this family-run haven is home to rare Belted Galloway cattle, Red Deer, Dutch Spotted sheep, and even ostriches and emus—each carefully nurtured to provide the finest, healthiest produce for our neighbors. Here, tradition meets innovation, and every cut of meat, every farm-fresh offering, tells a story of care.  

Step into our farm shop, and you’ll discover a curated selection of seasonal, locally sourced delights. From succulent venison to rich, marbled beef, our shelves are stocked with the flavors of Aberdeenshire’s rugged landscape. We believe in transparency—know where your food comes from, and taste the difference that ethical farming makes.  

Sustainability isn’t a buzzword here; it’s our way of life. Our animals roam freely, our practices are rooted in respect for the land, and every product reflects our commitment to quality. Whether you’re a local or a visitor, our farm shop invites you to slow down, savor, and connect with the rhythms of rural Scotland.  

Come experience Little Rowater—where passion meets pasture, and every bite is a taste of Aberdeenshire’s finest. Visit us, and take home more than just food; take home a piece of the land we love.  

*(Farm shop open [insert hours]. Find us near Cornhill—your gateway to fresh, premium produce in Aberdeenshire.)*

name: Wark Farm
description:
**Wark Farm: Where Tradition Meets Taste in the Heart of Aberdeenshire**  

At Wark Farm, every cut tells a story—of rich Scottish soil, generations of care, and flavors worth savoring.  

Nestled in Alford, Aberdeenshire (AB33 8LL), this organic farm and craft butchery is a haven for those who cherish honest, exceptional food. Here, heritage isn’t just history—it’s in the dry-cured meats hanging in the air, the Galloway beef aged to perfection, and the Hebridean lamb raised on open pastures. It’s in the wild venison, the seasonal pies, and the blue tits nesting where life feels most alive.  

Step into the farm shop, and you’ll find more than fresh local produce—you’ll discover a rhythm. The hum of baking during peak pie season. The quiet pride of lambing and calving seasons past. The careful craft of butchery, where tradition meets modern taste. Every product, from farm-cured charcuterie to wild game, is a testament to sustainability and skill.  

Visiting Wark Farm isn’t just shopping—it’s connecting. To the land, the animals, and the hands that bring them to your table. The farm shop welcomes you with the warmth of Aberdeenshire’s community, offering not just food, but an experience.  

Come for the quality. Stay for the story. Taste the difference at Wark Farm—where every bite is a return to what real food should be.  

*(Opening times and visitor details available at the farm shop.)*

name: Norvite Farm & Country
description:
**Norvite Farm & Country: Where Heritage Meets the Finest Local Flavours**  

For over 40 years, Norvite Farm & Country has been a trusted name in Aberdeenshire—a family-run haven where quality, expertise, and tradition come together. Nestled in the heart of South Blackbog, this isn’t just a farm shop; it’s a celebration of local abundance, backed by a Royal Warrant for excellence in animal nutrition and a passion for serving both land and community.  

Step into Norvite’s farm shop, and you’ll discover a carefully curated selection of fresh, seasonal produce—each item a testament to Aberdeenshire’s rich agricultural heritage. From crisp vegetables to artisanal pantry staples, every offering reflects the care of local growers and the farm’s deep-rooted commitment to quality. But Norvite is more than a place to shop; it’s an experience. The warmth of knowledgeable staff, the rustic charm of the store, and the pride in every product make it a destination for those who value authenticity.  

Beyond the shelves, Norvite’s legacy shines. As specialists in animal feeds and supplements, their expertise extends to horses, pets, and livestock—making them a trusted partner for farmers and families alike. Yet, it’s the farm shop that invites you to slow down, savour, and connect. Here, the rhythm of the seasons guides what’s on display, ensuring every visit offers something new.  

Come for the freshest Aberdeenshire produce. Stay for the stories, the service, and the simple joy of food done right. Visit Norvite Farm & Country—where tradition tastes extraordinary.

name: World Horse Welfare Belwade Farm
description:
**A Sanctuary of Compassion, Craft, and Connection**  

At World Horse Welfare Belwade Farm, every apple, every hoofprint, and every handpicked product tells a story of care—for animals, land, and community. Nestled along the A93 in Aberdeenshire, this isn’t just a farm; it’s a haven where rescued horses heal, local flavors thrive, and visitors leave nourished in more ways than one.  

Born from a mission to champion respect and compassion for horses, Belwade Farm has grown into a beacon of hope—where abandoned donkeys like Mia find friendship, and Scottish horse lovers rally to support ethical care. But the farm’s heartbeat extends beyond its stables. Step into their **farm shop in Aberdeenshire**, and you’ll discover shelves lined with **fresh, seasonal produce**, each item a testament to the region’s rich soil and the hands that tend it. From artisan jams to crisp, just-picked vegetables, every bite carries the integrity of local partnership.  

The shop itself is a reflection of the farm’s values: uncluttered, welcoming, and designed to let quality speak for itself. Whether you’re here to **sponsor a stableyard** (from just £5 a month) or simply to savor the simplicity of honest food, you’re part of something bigger.  

Come for the **fresh local produce**. Stay for the quiet pride of a place that does good—and does it beautifully. Visit Belwade Farm, where every purchase supports a world where horses, and humans, thrive together.  

*Open at the farm shop—check times and plan your trip today.*

name: Harbro Country Store
description:
**Harbro Country Store: Where Rural Tradition Meets Modern Flavour**  

In the heart of Aberdeenshire, Harbro Country Store is more than a farm shop—it’s a celebration of honest, wholesome living. Located on Steven Road, this trusted destination has been serving Scotland’s farming and rural communities for generations. Step inside, and you’ll find a treasure trove of fresh local produce, premium animal feeds, and everything you need to nurture the land—and the life—you love.  

Rooted in heritage but built for today, Harbro Country Store is a cornerstone of rural Scotland. Their farm shop brims with seasonal delights, from crisp vegetables to artisan staples, all sourced with care from nearby growers. Need expert advice? Their team combines decades of knowledge with genuine passion, whether you’re stocking up on farming supplies or selecting the perfect feed for your animals. This is where practicality meets pride—where every product tells a story.  

What sets Harbro apart? A commitment to quality that’s as unwavering as the Aberdeenshire landscape. The farm shop is a hub of freshness, offering visitors a taste of Scotland’s finest, from pantry essentials to garden must-haves. The shelves are curated with purpose; the service, warm and knowledgeable. It’s not just a store—it’s an experience, designed for those who value authenticity.  

Come for the produce, stay for the connection. Whether you’re a local farmer, a pet owner, or simply craving the best of the countryside, Harbro Country Store welcomes you. Taste the difference. Feel the tradition. Discover Aberdeenshire’s hidden gem.

name: Boutique Farm Bothies - Barley Bothy, The Sheep Shed, The Dairy at Denend & Denend Farmhouse
description:
**Escape to the Quiet Luxury of Aberdeenshire’s Most Charming Farm Retreats**  

At **Boutique Farm Bothies**, history, comfort, and the wild beauty of Scotland’s countryside collide. Nestled in the rolling hills of Newton of Begshill, Aberdeenshire, this collection of lovingly restored farm buildings—**Barley Bothy, The Sheep Shed, The Dairy at Denend, and Denend Farmhouse**—offers more than a stay; it’s an invitation to slow down, breathe deep, and live deliberately.  

Each bothy tells a story. Once the heartbeat of a working farm, these spaces now blend rustic charm with elegant simplicity. Vintage treasures, thoughtful details, and an unpretentious nod to their agricultural past make them feel like hidden gems. Floor-to-ceiling windows frame the untamed landscape, blurring the line between inside and out. This is where glamour meets authenticity—where you wake to birdsong and fall asleep under skies unpolluted by city lights.  

But the magic doesn’t end at your doorstep. The **farm shop** is a celebration of Aberdeenshire’s bounty, stocked with **fresh seasonal produce** and artisanal goods. Whether it’s creamy local cheeses, just-laid eggs, or homemade preserves, every bite carries the taste of the land. It’s a testament to the farm’s commitment to quality, community, and the slow food movement.  

Come for the peace, stay for the connection. Wander the fields, picnic by the stream, or simply curl up with a book by the wood burner. **Boutique Farm Bothies** isn’t just a place—it’s a feeling. Book your escape and taste the quiet luxury of Scottish farm life.  

*Visit our **farm shop in Aberdeenshire** and discover the art of slow living.*

name: Forage Farm Shop and Kitchen
description:
**Fresh, Local, Uncompromising: Forage Farm Shop and Kitchen**  

At Forage Farm Shop and Kitchen, we believe the best flavors come from the land you can see. Nestled in the heart of the Penllyn Estate Farm in the Vale of Glamorgan, this award-winning destination is where field, farm, and sea meet with effortless elegance.  

Forage began with a simple mission: to celebrate Welsh produce at its peak. Today, it’s a thriving hub—part farm shop, part restaurant, part butchery—where every ingredient tells a story. The shelves are stocked with fresh seasonal produce, much of it grown or sourced within miles. The kitchen transforms these raw treasures into dishes that taste of place and time. And behind the counter, you’ll find cuts of meat so thoughtfully prepared, they redefine what farm-to-table means.  

But Forage is more than a farm shop in the Vale of Glamorgan—it’s an experience. Sip a Cave-Aged Welsh gin from Silver Circle Distillery, its flavors deepened by time in local caverns. Gather for events where the air hums with laughter and the scent of wood-fired cooking. Take home a taste of Wales, whether it’s a jar of honey, a loaf of sourdough, or a ready-made meal crafted with care.  

This is food as it should be: honest, vibrant, and deeply connected to the land. Come for the freshness. Stay for the flavor. Forage is waiting.  

*(Opening times and visitor details available at the farm shop.)*

name: Chase Farm Milk
description:
**Chase Farm Milk: Where Tradition Meets the Freshest Taste of Gloucestershire**  

At the heart of the Forest of Dean, where the Severn and Wye Rivers carve the landscape, Chase Farm Milk has been a trusted name for generations. This family-run farm delivers the purest raw and pasteurised milk, along with farm-fresh chicken and duck eggs—straight from their fields to your table.  

Nestled on Miss Grace’s Lane in Tidenham Chase, Chase Farm is more than a working farm; it’s a destination. Their farm shop is a celebration of local abundance, offering seasonal produce that reflects the rhythms of the land. Here, you’ll find the kind of quality that only comes from hands-on care: rich, creamy milk from grass-fed cows, eggs with yolks like liquid gold, and a selection of curated goods that support Gloucestershire’s farming community.  

Visiting Chase Farm is an experience. The shop’s rustic charm invites you to slow down, savor, and connect with where your food comes from. Whether you’re a local or passing through, the warmth of the family’s hospitality is as unmistakable as the freshness of their offerings.  

Come taste the difference tradition makes. Chase Farm Milk isn’t just a stop—it’s the essence of Gloucestershire’s finest, waiting to be discovered. Open at the farm shop for those who appreciate food at its source. Your table deserves nothing less.

name: Pengethley Farm Shop
description:
**Pengethley Farm Shop: Where Herefordshire’s Finest Flavours Begin**  

At Pengethley Farm Shop, tradition tastes extraordinary. Nestled in the lush Wye Valley on the outskirts of Ross-on-Wye, this award-winning farm shop and butchery is a celebration of Herefordshire’s richest bounty—handpicked, handmade, and served with pride.  

For generations, Pengethley has been a cornerstone of local farming, and today, its shop is a testament to that legacy. Step inside to discover shelves lined with seasonal stars: plump Wye Valley strawberries, tender asparagus, and vibrant rhubarb, all grown just moments from where they’re sold. But the magic doesn’t stop there. Their butchery crafts succulent cuts from their own herds, while the on-site bakery fills the air with the scent of golden sausage rolls, flaky pies, and quiches made with farm-fresh ingredients. Every bite is a tribute to sustainability and skill.  

What sets Pengethley apart isn’t just the quality—it’s the connection. Here, "local" isn’t a label; it’s a promise. Cheeses from nearby dairies, crisp seasonal produce, and pantry staples from trusted neighbours share space with their own legendary meats and baked goods. The shop itself is a haven of rustic elegance, where every jar, loaf, and cut tells a story.  

Visit Pengethley Farm Shop and taste Herefordshire at its best. Whether you’re stocking up for supper or savouring a pastry fresh from the oven, this is where food feels like home—and farming feels like family. Open now, ready to welcome you.

name: Pitney Farm Shop
description:
**Pitney Farm Shop: Where Organic Luxury Meets Honest Somerset Roots**  

At Pitney Farm Shop, we believe the finest food shouldn’t cost the earth—just your drive to Somerset.  

Tucked into the rolling hills of Langport, our farm shop is a celebration of the land, the seasons, and the quiet art of growing well. Housed in the charming Wagon House, we’ve turned a corner of Somerset into a destination for those who crave fresh, organic produce without the premium price tag. Here, the soil’s richness speaks through every carrot, potato, and heirloom tomato—70 varieties grown with care, harvested with pride.  

This is farming as it should be: uncomplicated, sustainable, and deeply connected to the community. Our shelves are stocked with the kind of honest ingredients that transform meals—crisp greens, sun-ripened fruit, and artisan staples from local makers who share our values. The shop itself is a reflection of the landscape: warm, welcoming, and designed to let the produce shine.  

Open Monday to Saturday, a visit here is more than a grocery run—it’s a chance to taste the difference of food grown close to home. Whether you’re stocking up for the week or simply wandering among the crates of just-picked bounty, you’ll leave with more than a bag of vegetables. You’ll take home a piece of Somerset’s best.  

Come for the freshness. Stay for the feeling. Pitney Farm Shop—where every bite tells a story.  

*(Farm shop in Somerset | Fresh seasonal produce | Organic vegetables near Langport)*

name: Cows Hill Farm Shop
description:
**Cows Hill Farm Shop: Where Heritage Meets the Finest Rare Breed Meats**  

In the rolling hills of Gloucestershire, Cows Hill Farm Shop is a celebration of tradition, taste, and time-honoured craftsmanship.  

For generations, this family-run farm in Hewelsfield has been home to the award-winning Hewelsfield Herd—pedigree Rare Breed Berkshire Pork, British Lop Bacon, and Old Gloucester Beef, all reared the old-fashioned way. Winners of the Slow Food Award (2008) and Local Food Producer of the Year (2007), their commitment to forgotten breeds and sustainable farming isn’t just a practice—it’s a passion.  

Step into their farm shop, and you’ll find the freshest seasonal produce, from succulent cuts of rare breed pork to rich, marbled beef, all raised on their pastures. Every product tells a story of care, from field to fork. The shop itself is a haven for food lovers—a place where the scent of freshly butchered meats mingles with the warmth of local hospitality.  

Open to visitors, Cows Hill Farm Shop invites you to experience the difference tradition makes. Whether you’re a chef seeking the finest ingredients or a home cook who values provenance, their free local delivery ensures that exceptional quality is never out of reach.  

Come for the heritage. Stay for the flavour. Taste what happens when farming is done right.  

*(Visit Cows Hill Farm Shop in Hewelsfield, Gloucestershire—your gateway to rare breed meats and fresh, local produce.)*

name: Cowbridge farm shop
description:
**Cowbridge Farm Shop: Where Tradition Meets the Freshest Flavours of the Vale of Glamorgan**  

At Cowbridge Farm Shop, every bite tells a story of heritage, care, and the rich soil of Wales. Nestled in the heart of the Vale of Glamorgan at Marlborough Grange Farm, this family-run haven is more than a farm shop—it’s a celebration of honest, local produce, served with timeless Welsh hospitality.  

For generations, the same hands have tended these fields, upholding traditions that make each product exceptional. Step inside, and you’ll find shelves lined with the season’s best: crisp vegetables, artisan cheeses, and pantry staples crafted with pride. At the **Castle Farm shop**, you’ll find this exceptional lamb alongside fresh, seasonal produce, all sourced with the same care and commitment to quality.

name: Treleague Dairy
description:
**Treleague Dairy: Where Cornwall’s Cream Rises to the Top**  

At Treleague Dairy, we believe milk should taste the way nature intended—rich, unspoiled, and gloriously old-fashioned. Nestled in the rolling hills of Cornwall, our family-run farm has been perfecting the art of dairy for generations. Here, the cream still rises to the top, the glass bottles are always returned, and every scoop of ice cream tells a story of care.  

**Heritage in Every Bottle**  
Treleague Dairy is more than a farm; it’s a commitment to tradition. We pasteurise our milk gently, leaving it non-homogenised—just as it was decades ago—so you taste the full, velvety depth of Cornish pasture. From this milk, we craft award-winning cream, butter, and ice cream, each batch made with the same patience and pride that defines our name.  

**A Farm Shop Like No Other**  
Step into our farm shop, and you’ll find more than fresh dairy. It’s a celebration of Cornwall’s bounty: seasonal produce, local flavours, and the unmistakable taste of place. Our glass bottles, reused and cherished, reflect our pledge to sustainability—no plastic, no compromise.  

**Come Taste the Difference**  
Visit us at the farm gate. Let the grassy sweetness of our milk remind you how simple, honest food should be. Whether it’s the golden swirl of cream in your coffee or the slow churn of our ice cream, Treleague Dairy is Cornwall’s finest, bottled.  

**Open for discovery. Ready for delight.**

name: Cornhill Farm
description:
**Cornhill Farm: Where Heritage Meets Freshness in the Heart of Cornwall**  

For over a century, Cornhill Farm has been a cornerstone of Cornwall’s agricultural tradition—a place where the land’s bounty is nurtured with care and served with pride.  

Located just outside Camborne (TR14 0DH), this family-run farm blends deep roots with modern sustainability. Since 1912, the Olds family has stewarded these 350 acres, gradually expanding from humble beginnings to a thriving mixed farming enterprise. Today, Cornhill is home to 17,000 free-range hens, nourished by crops grown on-site, and a farm shop brimming with fresh, local produce.  

What sets Cornhill apart? **Honest farming, exceptional flavour.** Their free-range eggs and seasonal offerings—grown and gathered with minimal miles—reflect Cornwall’s rich terroir. The farm shop is a celebration of this ethos: shelves stocked with the freshest ingredients, from golden-yolked eggs to crisp, just-picked vegetables. Every product tells a story of careful husbandry and respect for the land.  

Visitors are welcomed into a space where rustic charm meets thoughtful curation. Whether you’re stocking up for the week or seeking a taste of Cornwall’s finest, the shop invites you to slow down, explore, and savour. (Opening times are available on-site—because good food shouldn’t be rushed.)  

Cornhill Farm isn’t just a destination; it’s a legacy. A place where generations of knowledge meet the simplicity of fresh, seasonal eating. Come for the quality. Stay for the connection. **Taste the difference a century makes.**

name: Sheppy's Cider Farm
description:
**Sheppy’s Cider Farm: 200 Years of Craft, Tradition, and Somerset’s Finest Flavours**  

In the heart of Somerset, where rolling hills meet centuries of cider-making mastery, Sheppy’s Cider Farm stands as a testament to time-honoured craft. Family-run for over 200 years, this is where tradition and taste converge—one pressed apple at a time.  

Nestled between Taunton and Wellington in Three Bridges, Sheppy’s is more than a farm; it’s a legacy. As one of the oldest independent cider makers in the world, every bottle tells a story of patience, skill, and the rich terroir of Somerset. Here, the process is pure: apples are grown, harvested, pressed, and bottled on-site, ensuring a taste that’s as authentic as the land itself.  

But Sheppy’s isn’t just about cider—it’s an experience. Step into their award-winning farm shop, where shelves brim with fresh, seasonal produce and handcrafted delights. From crisp, tangy ciders to locally sourced treats, every product reflects the farm’s commitment to quality and community. Stay awhile: tour the orchards, witness the craft behind each batch, or unwind with a hot drink and homemade cake in their cosy café.  

Whether you’re a cider connoisseur, a lover of Somerset’s countryside, or simply seeking the finest farm shop in the region, Sheppy’s invites you to slow down and savour the moment. Taste tradition. Take home a piece of Somerset. Discover why some flavours are worth waiting for.  

*Visit Sheppy’s Cider Farm—where every sip is history in the making.*

At Halberton Court Farm Shop, we don’t just sell food—we grow, rear, and curate it with pride. Nestled on High Street in the heart of Devon (EX16 7AW), our farm shop is a celebration of local abundance, where every cut of meat, every crisp vegetable, and every bottle of cider tells a story of care and craftsmanship.

Walk into our shop, and you’ll find a handpicked selection of seasonal produce: plump fruits, fresh dairy, artisan beers, and ciders that taste of the countryside. Visit us near Tiverton and taste the difference that local love makes. Halberton Court Farm Shop isn’t just a stop—it’s where your food’s journey begins. Come hungry, leave inspired.

Every cut of meat, every jar of preserves, carries the unmistakable mark of Exmoor’s terroir.  

Open year-round, Besshill Farm Shop invites you to slow down and savor the best of Devon. Whether you’re a chef seeking the finest ingredients or a family stocking up for Sunday roast, we promise food as nature intended—simple, exceptional, and deeply rooted in place.  

Come taste the difference that only a true farm-to-table experience can deliver. Besshill Farm Shop: your gateway to Exmoor’s bounty.

name: Thorne's Farm Shop
description:
**Thorne’s Farm Shop: Where Devon’s Freshest Bounty Meets Timeless Tradition**  

In the heart of Hawthorn Gardens, Thorne’s Farm Shop is more than a destination—it’s a celebration of Devon’s rich soil and generations of care. Here, crisp cabbages and sun-warmed strawberries don’t just fill baskets; they tell a story.  

Since its founding, Thorne’s has been a cornerstone of local life, blending the rhythms of the land with the warmth of community. Step into their farm shop, and you’ll find shelves lined with the season’s best: cauliflowers so fresh they still carry the morning dew, leeks with earthy sweetness, and ruby-red cabbages that promise hearty meals. With “fresh from the field” picks like Brussels sprouts and kalettes priced at just £1, quality here is honest, accessible, and unpretentious.  

But Thorne’s is more than a farm shop—it’s an experience. Their café and deli serve dishes crafted from the same produce you’ll take home, while their cider (pressed from Devon apples) is a toast to tradition. Families flock to their Pick-Your-Own fields, where strawberries ripen under the summer sun (just leave the dogs at home—they’re not fans of the tunnels).  

Open Monday to Saturday (9am–5pm) and Sundays (10am–4pm), Thorne’s invites you to slow down, taste deeply, and leave with a basket full of Devon’s finest. Because the best ingredients aren’t just grown—they’re gathered with pride.  

**Come for the produce. Stay for the passion.**

name: Milk's Up!
description:
**Milk’s Up! – Where Happy Cows Create the Creamiest Organic Milk in Devon.**  

At **North Hole Farm** on Devon’s wild coast, between the golden beaches of **Croyde and Woolacombe**, we do dairy differently. Our cows roam free, choose when to be milked by robots, and graze on lush organic pastures—because great milk starts with happy cows. The result? **Farm Fresh Organic Whole Milk** so rich, the cream rises just like it used to.  

This is farming as it should be: honest, ethical, and uncomplicated. For generations, our family has tended this land, but innovation drives us forward. The **milking robots** grant our herd freedom, while our **farm shop** brings their bounty straight to you. Taste the difference in every bottle—thick, velvety, and bursting with the clean, grassy notes of **North Devon’s coast**.  

Step into our **farm shop** and discover more than milk. We curate the best **fresh local produce**, from artisan cheeses to seasonal vegetables, all grown or sourced with the same care we give our herd. It’s a celebration of Devon’s flavors, served with a view of rolling pastures and ocean breezes.  

Come for the milk. Stay for the moment. **Milk’s Up!** isn’t just a farm—it’s a return to real food, crafted slowly and savored fully. Visit us, taste the tradition, and see why the best things in life rise to the top.  

*(Open daily at our **farm shop in Devon**—where every drop tells a story.)*

**Red Barn Farm Shop: Where Somerset’s Freshest Flavours Come Home**  

At Red Barn Farm Shop, every bite tells a story of Somerset’s rich soil, honest craftsmanship, and generations of care.  

Tucked in the heart of Hinton, our family-run farm shop is a celebration of local abundance. Here, the eggs are still warm from free-range hens—some from our own bantam flock—while crisp vegetables, sourced from Bristol Market and nearby growers, burst with just-picked vitality. Our chiller and freezer gleam with premium cuts from Blackmore Vale Butchery, alongside artisan sausages from The Sausage Shed and Windmill Farm. And the bread? A daily ritual of crusty perfection: Taylors of Bruton on Wednesdays, The Bakery at West Camel on Fridays, Lievito of Lovington on Saturdays.  

This is more than a farm shop in Somerset; it’s a bridge between field and table. We curate only what we’d serve at our own kitchen—no compromises, no shortcuts. The rhythm of the seasons guides our shelves, ensuring freshness isn’t a label but a promise.  

Step inside, and the difference is immediate: the earthy scent of fresh produce, the warmth of a family’s dedication, the quiet pride of supporting local hands. Whether you’re stocking up for the week or hunting for a taste of Somerset’s finest, Red Barn is where tradition meets today’s table.  

Come hungry. Leave rooted.

name: Tibbs Farm Cafe
description:
**Tibbs Farm Café: Where 300 Years of Heritage Meets the Freshest Flavours of East Sussex**  

Five minutes from the cobbled charm of Rye, Tibbs Farm Café stands as a timeless escape—a working farm with views that stretch across the Tillingham Valley, where hop gardens ripple in the breeze and the land tells a story three centuries deep.  

This is a place rooted in legacy. One of only 40 remaining hop growers in the UK, Tibbs Farm has nurtured the same soil since the 1700s. Today, the family’s passion for honest, homegrown food shines through in every detail: Romney sheep graze the pastures, Sussex cattle roam the fields, and the farm shop overflows with fresh seasonal produce, all grown, raised, or crafted on-site.

name: Westons Farm Shop

**Westons Farm Shop: Where Heritage Meets the Freshest Sussex Bounty**  

For over 150 years, Westons Farm has been a quiet cornerstone of West Sussex’s countryside—a place where tradition and taste converge. Nestled on Weston’s Hill, just two miles from Horsham and the scenic Downs Link, this family-run farm shop is more than a destination; it’s a celebration of Sussex’s rich agricultural legacy.  

Built as a model Victorian farm in the 1870s, Westons carries the weight of centuries of farming wisdom. Today, it’s a thriving hub for fresh, local produce, handpicked from the land and trusted suppliers. Since opening the farm shop in 2003, the Westons family has welcomed visitors to experience the best of the region—seasonal vegetables, artisan cheeses, and pantry staples, all curated with care.  

Step inside, and the difference is immediate. The shop’s rustic charm meets modern elegance, with shelves lined with vibrant, just-picked offerings. Here, food isn’t just stocked—it’s sourced with purpose, supporting nearby growers and sustainable practices. Whether you’re stocking up for the week or seeking a taste of Sussex’s finest, every visit feels like a discovery.  

Open year-round, Westons Farm Shop invites you to slow down, savor, and connect with the land. Come for the freshest seasonal produce in West Sussex—stay for the warmth of a farm that’s been feeding families for generations. The countryside is calling. Will you answer?

name: Heckfield Home Farm
description:
**Heckfield Home Farm: Where the Land Feeds the Soul**  

At Heckfield Home Farm, every seed sown and every harvest gathered is a testament to the art of slow, thoughtful farming. Nestled on the historic Heckfield Estate in Hampshire, this 400-acre biodynamic haven is more than a farm—it’s a living dialogue between soil and season. Here, Guernsey cows graze lush pastures, flocks of sheep dot the landscape, and rows of organic produce thrive under careful hands. This is farming as it was meant to be: regenerative, reverent, and deeply connected to the plate.  

Steeped in the rhythms of nature, Heckfield Home Farm is a masterclass in sustainability. The market garden yields vibrant seasonal vegetables and flowers, while the on-site dairy transforms rich Guernsey milk into artisan cheeses and creams. The farm shop, a treasure trove of fresh local produce, invites you to taste the difference biodynamics makes—each bite a story of terroir and care.  

Visiting is an experience for the senses. Wander past sunlit fields, breathe in the scent of freshly cut herbs, and linger in the farm shop, where jars of honey, wheels of cheese, and bouquets of just-picked blooms await. The next produce sale on **Saturday, 6th September**, is a chance to take home a piece of this edible artistry.  

Come for the farm-fresh eggs, stay for the quiet magic of a place where food is grown, not just made. Heckfield Home Farm isn’t just a destination—it’s a return to what nourishes us, body and soul.  

*(Plan your visit: Farm shop open [days/hours]. Located on Bramshill Road, Hampshire RG27 0LA.)*

The **Glasshouse Café** invites you to linger over a cup of tea, while the **Gift & Plant Shop** offers a curated selection of botanical treasures to take home.

**Visit Mayfield Lavender—your escape is just down Reigate Road.**

But The Old Piggery is more than a pitstop. It’s a celebration of craftsmanship. Their **genuine sheepskin rugs, Jacob sheepskin throws, and sheepskin home decor** are heirloom-quality, each piece a testament to sustainable British farming. The farm shop brims with **seasonal, locally sourced produce**, from artisan cheeses to just-picked fruits—every item chosen with care.  

Parking is plentiful, the welcome is warm, and the details—**from sheepskin stools to mittens**—are designed to delight. Whether you’re here for **afternoon tea in West Sussex**, a unique home find, or simply to soak in the pastoral charm, The Old Piggery invites you to slow down and savor the good things in life.

**Eves Hill Farm: Where Regenerative Farming Meets Norfolk’s Finest Flavors**  

At Eves Hill Farm, we don’t just grow food—we grow a legacy. Nestled in the heart of Norfolk on Norwich Road, this family-run farm is rewriting the future of agriculture, one acre at a time. Here, native Hereford cattle, Saddleback pigs, and free-range hens thrive on land nurtured by regenerative practices, producing nutrient-rich food while healing the soil. The result? A farm shop brimming with fresh, seasonal produce that’s as good for you as it is for the earth.  

Step into our farm shop (open Tuesday to Saturday, 10 am–4 pm), and you’ll find more than just groceries—you’ll discover a celebration of Norfolk’s bounty. From our own pasture-raised meats and eggs to handpicked local cheeses, preserves, and artisan goods, every item tells a story of care and community. name: Bramblebee Farms

We prioritise eco-friendly practices, native breeds, and a deep respect for the soil that sustains us. Every cut in our farm shop reflects this commitment—seasonal, local, and unwaveringly fresh.

Open for discerning shoppers and curious food lovers alike, Bramblebee Farms invites you to experience farming as it should be—thoughtful, flavourful, and full of life. Come for the best farm shop in Norfolk; stay for the connection to something real.  

Taste the difference tradition makes. We’re waiting for you at 219 Outwell Road.

description:
**The Wild Pig Farm Shop: Where Heritage Meets the Sky**  

At The Wild Pig Farm Shop, tradition takes flight—both on the land and above it.  

Since 2006, this Oxfordshire gem has been the proud home of Gloucestershire Old Spot pigs, roaming freely across eighty acres of lush pasture alongside sheep, goats, hens, and even llamas. But this is no ordinary farm. It’s a destination. A place where artisanal food meets adventure, where the scent of fresh-baked bread mingles with the thrill of hot air balloon rides over the rolling countryside.  

The Wild Pig is a pioneer—the first farm in the world to earn TSG approval, a testament to its unwavering commitment to quality and heritage. Recognized by Compassion in World Farming for excellence in animal welfare, every cut of meat, every jar of preserves, and every loaf in the farm shop tells a story of care. Here, sustainability isn’t a trend; it’s a legacy.  

Step into the farm shop, and you’ll find a curated selection of fresh, seasonal produce—each item a celebration of local craftsmanship. The butchery showcases premium cuts from pigs raised the old-fashioned way: slowly, ethically, and with respect. It’s food as it should be—honest, flavorful, and deeply connected to the land.  

Whether you’re here to fill a basket with the finest farm shop offerings in Oxfordshire or to soar above the fields in a hot air balloon, The Wild Pig invites you to experience the extraordinary. Come taste the difference. Come see the sky.

**Worton Kitchen Garden: Where Wild Bread Meets Wild Beauty**  

At Worton Kitchen Garden, the scent of wood-fired bread mingles with the perfume of freshly cut dahlias—a place where rustic charm meets quiet luxury. Nestled in the heart of Oxfordshire, this working farm is a celebration of slow, intentional living: organic flour turned into crusty loaves, seasonal blooms arranged with artistry, and suppers that taste of the land itself.  

The story begins with fire and flour. Every loaf here is baked the old way—in a wood-fired oven, using 100% organic grain—resulting in bread that’s as wild as it is wholesome. But Worton is more than a bakery. It’s a haven for those who crave authenticity. The farm shop brims with fresh, local produce, each item chosen with care. On Fridays and Saturdays, the magic lingers into the evening, with the glow of the oven lighting up the Oxfordshire dusk.  

Come for the bread, stay for the beauty. On the last Friday of each month, join Arthur Parkinson—garden writer, illustrator, and florist—as he transforms dahlias and foliage from Worton’s fields into breathtaking arrangements. Then, linger for the Supper Club, where a single seasonal ingredient takes center stage in dishes designed to delight.  

This is farming at its most poetic: honest, elegant, alive. Whether you’re stocking up at the farm shop, learning the art of floral design, or savoring a meal under the stars, Worton Kitchen Garden invites you to taste, touch, and slow down.  

**Open Wednesday to Sunday. Find us at Worton Farm, Oxfordshire—where every loaf, every bloom, every moment is made to matter.**

Open for visits, the shop invites you to **taste the difference** that freedom—and a little moo democracy—makes. Come for the **fresh local produce**, stay for the charm, and leave with a smile (and a full basket). **Primrose Vale isn’t just a farm. It’s a moo-vement.**

name: Havenhills Field & Kitchen

For the adventurous eater who craves both flavor and nourishment but lacks the time to cook from scratch, Havenhills Field & Kitchen is your answer. Nestled in the rolling hills of Shropshire, our farm is built on a simple promise: food should be as pure as it is delicious. Our story is rooted in respect—for the land, for tradition, and for the busy lives of modern food lovers. Each week, we craft a fresh menu inspired by the season’s finest offerings, ensuring every bite is a celebration of nature’s rhythm. Whether you’re stocking up at our farm shop or simply seeking the crisp taste of just-picked produce, every visit is a reminder that eating well doesn’t have to be complicated.  

Step into our farm shop and discover the heart of Shropshire’s harvest: vibrant greens, sun-ripened fruit, and artisanal goods, all grown and curated with care. Here, convenience meets conscience, and every purchase supports a healthier you—and a greener world.  

Come taste the difference at Havenhills. Your table—and the earth—will thank you.  

*(Farm shop open now in Brockton, Shropshire. Fresh seasonal produce, grown for those who demand better.)*

**Hall Farm Shop and Café: Fresh. Local. Uncomplicated.**

**Spinney Farm: Where Lincolnshire’s Freshest Produce Meets Timeless Tradition**

Step into the farm shop, open six days a week, and you’ll find shelves brimming with seasonal abundance. Think plump tomatoes still warm from the greenhouse, leafy greens picked at dawn, and—when summer arrives—the joy of pick-your-own strawberries, a tradition as beloved as the farm itself. Every carrot, every apple, every jar of local honey tells a story of Lincolnshire’s rich soil and the hands that tend it.  

But Spinney Farm isn’t just about what grows—it’s about how it’s shared. The shop’s warm, unpretentious charm invites you to linger, to taste, to chat with the growers. It’s where food feels like it should: fresh, honest, and full of flavor.  

Come for the produce. Stay for the connection. Spinney Farm isn’t just a farm shop in Lincolnshire—it’s where good food and good people meet. Visit us, and taste the difference tradition makes.

Rooted in tradition but thriving on innovation, **The Whole Hogg** is built on two unwavering principles: **quality and sustainability**. Every jar of chutney, every cut of meat, every loaf of bread tells a story—of local suppliers, careful hands, and soil-rich Yorkshire land. Their farm shop bursts with **artisan cheeses, freshly baked goods, and pantry staples** you’ll want to take home. And in the tearoom? What sets them apart? **A commitment to community.** The shop’s timber beams and friendly banter make you feel like family, while their focus on **local, ethically sourced ingredients** ensures every bite supports the land they love. name: P & J Emsley Cumboots Dairy Farm
description:
**Fresh Milk, Straight from the Field—Just as Nature Intended.**  

At **P & J Emsley Cumboots Dairy Farm** in Orlajac, North Yorkshire, we believe milk should taste the way it was meant to: rich, creamy, and uncomplicated. Here, our small herd of free-range cows graze on open pastures, and their milk travels just steps from our barn to your bottle—no middlemen, no plastic waste, just honest goodness.  

For generations, our family has tended this land with care. Today, we’ve kept tradition alive while embracing simple innovations, like our **farm-fresh milk vending machine**. Bring your own bottle or pick up one of ours—each sip is pasteurised for safety but left **unhomogenised and unstandardised**, so you taste the full, natural character of the milk. It’s a small act with big impact: supporting local farmers, cutting food miles, and preserving the integrity of real dairy.  

Beyond the milk, our **farm shop in North Yorkshire** offers fresh, seasonal produce—thoughtfully sourced, just like everything we do. Whether you’re stocking up for the week or simply craving a taste of the countryside, every visit here is a return to what matters: quality, community, and the quiet joy of knowing where your food comes from.  

**Ready to taste the difference?** Stop by, fill your bottle, and take home a little piece of Cumboots Dairy Farm. The fields are open, the milk is cold, and the welcome is warm.

name: Rock House Farm
description:
**Rock House Farm: Where Honest Food Meets Timeless Tradition**  

At Rock House Farm, we believe the best flavors begin with respect—for the land, the animals, and the craft of farming.  

Nestled in the rolling hills of North Yorkshire, just outside Bedale, Rock House Farm is a family-run haven for those who crave food as it should be: simple, seasonal, and full of character. Here, rare-breed pigs roam freely, lambs graze on rich pasture, and hens peck at open fields, yielding eggs with yolks as golden as the morning sun. Every jar of homemade chutney, every slice of farmhouse cake, and every cut of pasture-raised meat tells a story of care, tradition, and a deep connection to the land.  

Sustainability isn’t a trend here—it’s the foundation. From the soil to the shop, every step is deliberate. Our farm shop is a celebration of this philosophy, offering fresh, local produce that’s as wholesome as it is delicious. Whether it’s free-range eggs, slow-reared lamb, or our small-batch jams, each item reflects the rhythms of the seasons and the skill of hands-on farming.  

Visit us at Station Road, Newton-le-Willows, and taste the difference time and attention make. Join us for our pop-up shop and BBQ on Friday, 4th July (4PM–8PM), where the fire is lit, the tables are set, and the farm’s bounty takes center stage.  

This is food as it was meant to be—honest, flavorful, and deeply satisfying. Come see (and taste) for yourself.  

*Rock House Farm: A farm shop in North Yorkshire where tradition meets the table.*

Open year-round, the farm shop on Racecourse Road is your gateway to North Yorkshire’s finest flavors. Whether you’re stocking up for supper or pausing for a moment of quiet beauty, Betton Farm welcomes you with open arms—and a taste of the good life, just as it should be.  

**Come for the produce. Stay for the magic.**

name: Caring For Life Garden Nurseries

**A Living Canvas of Light, Color, and Fresh Local Flavor.**  

At **Caring For Life Garden Nurseries** on Otley Old Road in West Yorkshire, the first thing you’ll notice is the glow—a towering glasshouse alive with vibrant houseplants, seasonal blooms, and the quiet hum of growth.
