name: Syke Farm Tea Room
description:
**Syke Farm Tea Room: Where the Lake District’s Bounty Meets Timeless Charm**  

Nestled in the heart of Buttermere, with the fells of Cumberland rising like a natural cathedral around it, Syke Farm Tea Room is more than a destination—it’s an experience. Here, the crisp mountain air carries the scent of fresh-baked goods, and the farm shop’s shelves gleam with the best of Cumbria’s seasonal produce.  

For generations, Syke Farm has been a sanctuary for travelers seeking the raw beauty of the Lake District. What began as a humble campsite—a place to rest under star-lit skies—has blossomed into a haven for food lovers and adventurers alike. The farm shop is a treasure trove of local craftsmanship: artisan cheeses, honey from nearby valleys, and preserves made with fruit picked at peak ripeness. Every jar, every loaf, tells a story of the land.  

Visitors come for the views—panoramic sweeps of Buttermere’s glassy waters and the rugged peaks of Borrowdale—but stay for the warmth of the farm’s embrace. The Tea Room, with its rustic elegance, invites you to linger over a pot of locally blended tea or a slice of cake made with eggs from the farm’s own hens. It’s simplicity, perfected.  

This is slow living at its finest. Whether you’re stocking up for a hike or savoring a quiet moment by the fire, Syke Farm reminds you: the best things in life are fresh, honest, and deeply rooted in place.  

Come taste the difference. The mountains are waiting.

name: Roast Mutton's Cumbrian Farm Shop
description:
**"Meat as it should be: honest, ethical, and unapologetically delicious."**  

At **Roast Mutton’s Cumbrian Farm Shop** in Westmorland and Furness, we believe in doing things the right way—not the easy way. Nestled in the heart of the Lake District, our farm shop is a haven for those who care about where their food comes from. Here, every cut of meat tells a story: of sustainable farming, of local farmers we know by name, and of a commitment to quality that never compromises.  

Our heritage is simple but profound. We source directly from Cumbrian farms, ensuring our meat is ethically produced, expertly butchered, and tailored to your needs. By buying larger portions of the animal, you help us support a system that values thoughtfulness over haste. The result? Unmatched flavor, traceability, and the satisfaction of eating with intention.  

Step into our farm shop on Askam Road, and you’ll find more than just meat. We curate fresh, seasonal produce—each item chosen for its quality and connection to our community. Whether you’re stocking up for the week or seeking the perfect cut for a special meal, every visit feels like a celebration of real food.  

We’re open Tuesday through Saturday, with hours designed for convenience (and the occasional early weekend start). Closed Sundays and Mondays to honor the rhythm of farm life.  

Come taste the difference that care makes. At Roast Mutton’s, good food isn’t just what we sell—it’s who we are.

name: Stouslie Farm Shop
description:
**Stouslie Farm Shop: Where Scottish Soil Meets Seasonal Magic**  

In the rolling hills of the Scottish Borders, Stouslie Farm Shop is more than a destination—it’s a celebration of land, labor, and the joy of harvest.  

For generations, Stouslie Farm House has been rooted in tradition, but this autumn, we’re adding a new chapter: our very first **Pumpkin Patch**. What began as a bold experiment—planting thousands of pumpkins—turned into a lesson in resilience (and a few surprises along the way). Now, we invite you to share in the reward: a **wholesome family day out**, where the air smells of earth and possibility.  

Step into our **farm shop**, and you’ll find shelves lined with **fresh, local produce**—each item a testament to the care of Scottish growers. From crisp apples to golden honey, every jar and basket tells a story. But October is for pumpkins: carve them, cook them, or simply admire their rustic charm in our fields.  

This is farming at its most honest. No gimmicks, just **seasonal abundance** and the warmth of a community that values quality. Whether you’re stocking your pantry or hunting for the perfect pumpkin, Stouslie is a place to slow down and savor.  

**Visit us this autumn.** Taste what happens when passion meets patience. And take home more than just produce—take home a piece of the Scottish Borders.  

*(Opening times and visitor details available at the farm shop.)*  

---

name: Hallsford Farm Produce
description:
**Hallsford Farm Produce: Where Tradition Meets Taste in Every Bite.**  

Nestled in the rolling hills of Haggbeck, Cumberland, Hallsford Farm Produce is more than a farm—it’s a legacy. Featured on BBC One’s *The Farmer’s Country Showdown*, this family-run farm has built a reputation for excellence, delivering top-quality Shorthorn Beef, Llanwenog Lamb, and Rare Breed Pork, all raised with care on land they call home.  

For generations, Hallsford has championed traditional farming methods, working in harmony with the environment to produce meat that’s as flavorful as it is ethical. Their farm shop is a celebration of Cumberland’s bounty, offering fresh, seasonal produce that reflects the rhythms of the land. Here, every cut tells a story—of heritage breeds, sustainable practices, and a family’s unwavering commitment to quality.  

Step into their farm shop, and you’ll find more than just food; you’ll discover an experience. The shelves are stocked with the finest local offerings, from succulent meats to artisan accompaniments, all curated with the same attention to detail that earned Hallsford its loyal following. Whether you’re stocking your kitchen or planning an event, their catering service brings the farm’s excellence to your table.  

Visit Hallsford Farm Produce—where the freshest ingredients meet generations of passion. Taste the difference tradition makes.  

*(Farm shop open now in Haggbeck, Cumberland. Explore our fresh, local produce today.)*

name: Sunnyhills of Belford
description:
**Sunnyhills of Belford: Where Northumberland’s Freshest Flavors Meet Unforgettable Moments.**  

Just off South Road in the heart of Northumberland, Sunnyhills of Belford is more than a farm shop—it’s a celebration of local craftsmanship, family tradition, and the simple joy of exceptional food. For years, this charming destination has welcomed visitors with open arms, offering a taste of the region’s finest produce in a setting that feels both timeless and inviting.  

Step inside, and you’ll discover a treasure trove of fresh, seasonal delights: artisan cheeses, handcrafted pies, and premium cuts from Carters Butchers of Bamburgh. Every item tells a story of local passion, sourced from trusted producers who share Sunnyhills’ commitment to quality. Hungry? Stay awhile. Their wood-fired pizzas—crisp, fragrant, and made to order—are a must-try, whether you dine in their beautifully furnished space or take them to go.  

But Sunnyhills is more than a feast for the palate. It’s a place where families gather, children laugh, and memories are made. Let the little ones explore the sprawling play area, complete with a climbing fort and nest swing, while you savor a locally brewed drink from their fully licensed deli.  

Open seven days a week, with seasonal offerings and a convenient local delivery service, Sunnyhills of Belford is your gateway to Northumberland’s finest. Come for the food. Stay for the warmth. Leave with a deeper love for this corner of the world.  

*Visit Sunnyhills of Belford—where every bite, every moment, is crafted with care.*

description:

For generations, the Tweed Valley has been a haven for sustainable farming, and The Homestead carries that legacy forward. Their farm shop brims with **fresh, seasonal produce**—artisan cheeses, just-picked vegetables, and specialty drinks that capture the essence of the region. Each product is a testament to the skill of local producers and the unmatched quality of Scottish Borders soil.  

Step inside, and the experience unfolds. The rustic charm of the shop invites you to linger, while the café offers a taste of homegrown goodness amidst rolling hills and crisp country air. Whether you’re sipping a locally roasted coffee or selecting preserves for your pantry, every detail feels intentional, every flavor unforgettable.  

This is more than a stop—it’s a connection. To the land, to the community, and to the simple joy of food done right.  

**Visit The Homestead Café & Farm Shop. Taste the difference tradition makes.**  

*(Opening times and visitor details available at the farm shop.)*

description:

At Field & Fodder, we believe the best flavours begin with respect—for the land, for tradition, and for the hands that nurture both.  

Nestled in the rolling countryside of Bearpark, County Durham, this family-run farm blends heritage with hospitality. For generations, we’ve worked the soil with care, and today, that same dedication fills every shelf of our farm shop. Here, you’ll find fresh, seasonal produce—grown locally, chosen thoughtfully, and delivered with pride.  

Step inside, and the difference is immediate. Our farm shop is a celebration of simplicity: rustic charm meets modern elegance, with wooden crates of just-picked vegetables, artisan preserves, and pantry staples that tell a story. This isn’t just shopping; it’s a connection to the land. Every jar, every loaf, every cut of meat reflects our commitment to quality and community.  

We’re more than a farm shop in County Durham—we’re a destination. Whether you’re stocking up for the week or seeking a taste of the countryside, our doors are open. The rhythm here is unhurried, the welcome warm. Come for the freshest eggs at dawn, stay for the golden-hour glow over the fields.  

Taste the difference tradition makes. Visit Field & Fodder, where every bite carries the soul of the farm.  

*(Opening times and directions available at the farm shop.)*

name: Bill Quay Community Farm
description:
**A Sanctuary of Soil and Community—Where Freshness Meets Purpose**  

At **Bill Quay Community Farm**, the earth gives more than food—it nurtures connection. Nestled on **Hainingwood Terrace in Tyne and Wear**, this 27-acre green haven has been a lifeline since 1986, when locals and Gateshead Council transformed derelict land into a thriving hub for nature, wellness, and togetherness. Today, it stands as a testament to what happens when a community invests in itself: a place where soil, stories, and seasonal abundance flourish.  

Step into the **farm shop**, and you’ll taste the difference care makes. Every jar of honey, every crisp vegetable, is a product of the land’s generosity and the hands that tend it. This is **fresh local produce** at its purest—unpretentious, unfiltered, and unmistakably rooted in Tyne and Wear.  

But the farm’s true magic lies beyond its harvests. It’s in the way city sounds fade into birdsong, how strangers become neighbors over shared baskets of apples. Whether you’re here to stock your kitchen or simply breathe deeper, the rhythm of the farm invites you to slow down. The shop’s shelves, lined with honest ingredients, reflect a simple promise: **good food grown for good people**.  

Come for the **farm-fresh eggs**. Stay for the quiet joy of watching a child feed a goat, or the satisfaction of supporting a space that gives back. **Bill Quay Community Farm** isn’t just a destination—it’s a reminder of what matters.  

*Open today. Ready to welcome you.*

name: Wilson's Farm and Kitchen
description:
**Wilson’s Farm and Kitchen: Where Heritage Meets the Freshest Flavours of the Scottish Borders**  

For three generations, the Wilson family has turned soil into stories and harvests into hospitality. Nestled in the rolling hills of Cowbog, Scottish Borders, **Wilson’s Farm and Kitchen** is more than a working farm—it’s a living legacy of passion, quality, and connection. Since 1938, this land has been tended with care, and today, it invites you to taste the results.  

Step into our **farm shop**, and you’ll find shelves lined with **fresh, seasonal produce** grown just steps away. From crisp vegetables to artisan preserves, every jar and basket tells the story of our fields. But this isn’t just a place to shop—it’s an experience. Join us for **farm tours and food experiences**, where couples, families, and small groups can dig into the rhythms of rural life. Want something more intimate? Book a **private group tour** for friends or colleagues, and let us tailor a day of discovery just for you.  

What sets us apart? **Simplicity with soul.** Our farm shop is a celebration of local abundance, designed to let the ingredients speak for themselves. No fuss, just flavour. And because we believe food tastes better when it’s shared, we’ve made every visit warm, welcoming, and deeply personal.  

Come for the **freshest produce in the Scottish Borders**. Stay for the stories, the laughter, and the kind of connection that only happens over a basket of just-picked goodness. **We’re ready to welcome you—just check our opening times and drop by.** The farm gate is always open.

name: Mole Country Stores - Hexham
description:
**Mole Country Stores – Hexham: Where Northumberland’s Finest Produce Meets Timeless Farming Tradition**  

At the heart of Northumberland’s rolling countryside, Mole Country Stores – Hexham is more than a farm shop—it’s a celebration of honest, local abundance. Located just off the Corbridge Bypass Road, this storied destination has been a trusted hub for farmers, gardeners, and food lovers for generations. Step inside, and you’ll find shelves lined with the freshest seasonal produce, premium animal feeds, and thoughtfully curated home and garden essentials—all delivered with the warmth of a family-run business.  

Rooted in heritage yet forward-thinking, Mole Country Stores – Hexham is part of the Mole Valley Farmers network, a name synonymous with quality across the UK. But here, it’s the personal touch that stands out. The farm shop is a treasure trove of local flavors, from artisan cheeses to just-picked vegetables, each item telling a story of Northumberland’s rich soil and hardworking hands. Whether you’re stocking up on farming supplies or browsing for a weekend treat, the experience is effortless, inviting, and deeply satisfying.  

What sets this farm shop apart? It’s the commitment to community—the belief that great food and reliable tools should be accessible to everyone, from seasoned farmers to weekend gardeners. The welcoming aisles, the crisp scent of fresh produce, the knowledgeable staff ready with advice—it’s a place designed to make rural living feel both luxurious and grounded.  

Come for the quality, stay for the connection. Visit Mole Country Stores – Hexham today, and taste the difference that local, love-grown goodness makes. Your table—and your land—will thank you.

name: Bays Leap Dairy Farm
description:
**Bays Leap Dairy Farm: Where Gold-Standard Organic Milk Meets Northumberland’s Finest.**  

At Bays Leap Dairy Farm, we don’t just produce milk—we craft award-winning, organic dairy with a legacy of excellence. Nestled in the rolling hills of Northumberland, our family-run farm is home to happy, grass-fed cows and a trio of charming farm shops brimming with fresh, local goodness.  

**Heritage Meets Innovation**  
Twice crowned Gold Award winners at the International Cheese & Dairy Awards (2023 & 2024), we’re proud to uphold the purest traditions of organic farming—no additives, no shortcuts. Every bottle of our milk tells a story: of sunlit pastures, meticulous care, and a commitment to sustainability that’s as clear as the glass it’s bottled in.  

**From Farm to Table**  
Step into our farm shops and discover the taste of Northumberland at its freshest. Sip on velvety raw or pasteurised milk, savor grass-fed beef, or indulge in homemade ice-cream. Pair it with a rich bean-to-cup coffee, and you’ve got a morning ritual worth waking up for.  

**A Destination, Not Just a Shop**  
More than a farm shop in Northumberland, Bays Leap is an experience. Whether you’re stocking up on seasonal produce or simply soaking in the rustic charm, every visit feels like coming home.  

**Taste the Difference**  
Ready to try milk that’s as pure as it gets? Visit us—where every drop is gold-standard, and every bite is a celebration of the land. Open daily. See you at the farm.

name: Signature Farm Meats
description:

At the heart of Northumberland, on the quiet stretch of Cowpen Road, lies **Signature Farm Meats**—a family-run farm where time-honoured values meet exceptional quality. Today, their farm shop stands as a testament to that legacy, offering hand-selected meats and local produce in a setting that feels both timeless and welcoming.

Every cut of meat is reared with respect, every vegetable chosen at peak ripeness. The shelves are stocked with the best of the region, from rich, marbled beef to crisp, just-picked greens. It’s food as it should be: simple, pure, and full of character.  

But what truly sets Signature Farm Meats apart is the experience. The shop itself is a reflection of their philosophy—clean, uncluttered, and designed to let the ingredients speak for themselves. Visitors aren’t just customers; they’re guests, invited to linger over the day’s harvest or chat with the family about what’s in season.  

Come for the quality. Stay for the connection. **Signature Farm Meats** isn’t just a place to shop—it’s where food finds its soul. Visit us at 549 Cowpen Road and taste the difference tradition makes.

name: The Honey Tree
description:
**The Honey Tree: Where Fresh, Local Bounty Meets Timeless Charm**  

At The Honey Tree, we believe the best flavors begin just outside your door.  

Tucked along Heaton Road in Tyne and Wear, our farm shop is a haven for those who crave honest, seasonal produce—grown with care and served with pride. For years, we’ve been the trusted source for Newcastle’s freshest organic vegetables and fruit, handpicked and packed into our signature £20 boxes. Here, every tomato, apple, and leafy green tells a story of local soil and steadfast dedication.  

Step inside, and you’ll find more than a farm shop in Tyne and Wear—you’ll discover a rhythm. Each Friday at noon, our shelves brim with just-harvested goodness, from crisp seasonal vegetables to sun-ripened fruit, all sourced from nearby growers who share our values. The ritual is simple: place your order by Tuesday noon, and return to collect a box of nature’s finest, curated for your table. No fuss, no waste—just pure, vibrant flavor.  

But The Honey Tree is more than a place to shop. It’s where neighbors meet over the week’s harvest, where the scent of earth lingers on produce still warm from the field. Our doors open to those who appreciate food as it should be: fresh, local, and uncomplicated.  

Ready to taste the difference? Visit us at 68 Heaton Road, or order online today. Your table—and your community—will thank you.

name: Nook Farm Honey
description:
**Nook Farm Honey: Where British Honey Reaches Its Purest Perfection.**  

At Nook Farm in Cumberland, every jar of honey tells a story—of wildflower meadows, ancient beekeeping traditions, and the untamed beauty of the British countryside. Here, eight distinct, award-winning honeys are crafted with reverence for nature: raw, unpasteurised, and untouched by shortcuts. Three have earned accolades at the Great Taste and Great British Food Awards, a testament to their exceptional quality.  

For generations, Nook Farm has been a guardian of flavour. Their honeys—like Cumbrian Wildflower, Yorkshire Heather, and Scottish Blossom—are more than products; they’re a taste of place. Each variety captures the essence of its landscape, from heather-clad moors to blossom-laden orchards. This is honey as it was meant to be: unfiltered, unprocessed, and unapologetically pure.  

Beyond honey, the farm shop is a celebration of Cumberland’s bounty. Fresh, seasonal produce lines the shelves, sourced from trusted local growers. The shop itself is a destination—a rustic yet refined space where simplicity meets excellence. Visitors don’t just buy; they experience. They linger over golden jars, sample artisanal goods, and leave with a deeper connection to the land.  

Come to Nook Farm for honey that honours tradition. Stay for the warmth of a true farm shop experience. Taste the difference that care, craft, and Cumbrian soil can make. Your jar awaits.

name: Slack House Farm
description:
**Slack House Farm: Where the Soul of Cumberland Meets the Taste of Tradition.**  

Nestled on the Cumbria-Northumberland border, just west of Gilsland, Slack House Farm is more than a stopover—it’s a destination. Perched above the Irthing Valley, with sweeping views of Hadrian’s Wall country, this working farm blends rugged history with modern simplicity. Walkers, cyclists, and explorers on Route 72 find refuge here, but the true heartbeat of Slack House is its farm shop: a treasure trove of fresh, local produce, served with unpretentious warmth.  

For generations, this land has thrived at the edge of Kielder Forest, where clean air and rich soil shape every harvest. Today, Slack House Farm honors that legacy by offering seasonal, farm-to-table goods—think golden honey, crisp vegetables, and artisan preserves—all sourced from trusted neighbors and their own fields. The farm shop isn’t just a pit stop; it’s a celebration of Cumberland’s bounty, wrapped in the quiet luxury of authenticity.  

Step inside, and the rhythm slows. Shelves are lined with jars of summer berries, loaves of hearth-baked bread, and cuts of pasture-raised meat. The space is clean, uncluttered, and purposeful—a reflection of the land itself. Whether you’re fueling up after hiking Hadrian’s Wall or seeking the freshest ingredients for a countryside feast, Slack House delivers with quiet confidence.  

Come for the views. Stay for the taste. Slack House Farm isn’t just on the map—it’s a place that lingers in memory. Open now; the valley (and a perfect apple) awaits.

name: MiddleMay Lamb
description:

For decades, the same hands have tended these fields, blending time-honored methods with a deep respect for the land. The result? Flavorful lamb, artisanal farm shop staples, and a connection to the soil you can taste in every bite. Here, "local" isn’t a label—it’s a promise.  

Step into the MiddleMay farm shop, and you’ll find shelves lined with the best of the region: succulent lamb, seasonal vegetables, and handcrafted goods, all sourced from trusted neighbors. The space is designed to feel like an extension of the farm—rustic yet refined, where simplicity lets the ingredients shine. Whether you’re a home cook seeking the finest cuts or a visitor craving an authentic taste of Northumberland, this is where you’ll find it.  

Open year-round, the shop welcomes you to slow down, savor, and support a way of farming that’s disappearing elsewhere. Come for the quality; stay for the warmth of a family who knows every producer by name.  

Visit MiddleMay Lamb. Taste the difference tradition makes.

name: The Store Forge
description:
**The Store Forge: Where Heritage Meets Handcrafted Excellence in Northumberland**  

For over 80 years, The Store Forge has been a beacon of craftsmanship in Ashington, Northumberland—where wrought iron meets the warmth of a farm shop brimming with fresh, local bounty. Nestled at 15 Lintonville Terrace, this family-run haven blends artisanal metalwork with the finest seasonal produce, offering a rare fusion of tradition and taste.  

Born from generations of skilled welders and steel fabricators, The Store Forge is rooted in mastery. Every hinge, gate, and bespoke ironwork piece is crafted with Spanish and Italian components, a testament to uncompromising quality. But step inside, and you’ll discover another passion: a farm shop alive with the flavors of Northumberland. Here, shelves glow with fresh, local produce—each item handpicked, each bite a celebration of the region’s rich soil and dedicated producers.  

Visitors are welcomed into an experience as refined as it is rustic. The shop’s design mirrors the forge’s elegance—clean lines, thoughtful displays—while the offerings speak of authenticity. Whether you’re seeking artisan preserves, crisp seasonal vegetables, or a hand-forged heirloom for your home, every detail tells a story.  

Come for the craftsmanship; stay for the connection. The Store Forge isn’t just a destination—it’s a gathering place where heritage, flavor, and community intertwine. Taste the difference. See the artistry. Discover why this corner of Northumberland is truly one-of-a-kind.  

*Open now at the farm shop—your table, and your home, deserve nothing less.*

name: Five Houses Farm Shop & Kitchen
description:
**Five Houses Farm Shop & Kitchen: Where Tradition Meets Taste in North Yorkshire**  

At Five Houses Farm, every cut tells a story, and every bite celebrates craftsmanship.  

Nestled in the picturesque village of Crathorne, North Yorkshire, Five Houses Farm Shop & Kitchen is a haven for those who cherish quality, provenance, and the art of good food. With deep roots in the meat trade, the Kitson family has built a destination where tradition and modern curation collide—a place where the butchery takes centre stage, and the shelves brim with handpicked artisan delights.  

This isn’t just a farm shop; it’s a celebration of the land and its makers. The butchery dazzles with marinated specialities, dry-aged cuts, and displays that turn a simple visit into a sensory experience. Beyond the meats, the deli showcases the best of local and far-flung artisans—cheeses, preserves, and seasonal produce—each item chosen with a farmer’s care and a gourmet’s eye.  

Step inside, and you’ll find more than groceries. You’ll find a connection: to the North Yorkshire soil, to generations of know-how, and to the joy of eating well. Whether you’re stocking your pantry or seeking the perfect cut for a Sunday roast, Five Houses delivers with warmth and expertise.  

Visit the farm shop in Crathorne. Taste the difference tradition makes.

name: Mainsgill Farm Shop
description:
**Mainsgill Farm Shop: Where Yorkshire’s Finest Flavours Begin**  

At Mainsgill Farm Shop, tradition meets taste in the heart of North Yorkshire.  

Nestled in the rolling countryside near Richmond, Mainsgill Farm Shop is more than a destination—it’s a celebration of honest, local produce. For generations, this family-run farm has been a cornerstone of the community, delivering the freshest seasonal ingredients straight from field to table. name: Paradise Produce Farm Shop
description:
**A Rare Breed of Farming: Where Tradition Meets Taste at Paradise Produce Farm Shop**  

At Paradise Produce Farm Shop, every bite tells a story—one of heritage, care, and the rich soils of East Riding of Yorkshire.  

Tucked along Sutton Road in HU7 5XA, this isn’t just a farm shop; it’s a celebration of rare breeds and honest farming. Here, Oxford Sandy and Black pigs roam paddocks in summer and nest in straw-lined yards come winter. Jacob and LLeyn sheep graze on open pasture, their lambs raised on nothing but grass and haylage. Belted Galloway cattle mature slowly, yielding beef that’s as tender as it is sustainable. Even the eggs—from hens and ducks free to wander—change with the seasons, a testament to nature’s rhythm.  

Step into the farm shop, and you’ll find more than fresh local produce. You’ll discover wool from Jacob sheep spun into cozy knits, rustic "sheepski" hides, and a curated selection of goods that honor the land. This is farming as it should be: unhurried, unprocessed, and utterly delicious.  

Open year-round, Paradise Produce invites you to taste the difference tradition makes. Whether it’s the deep marbling of their beef, the sweetness of their rare-breed pork, or the golden yolks of free-range eggs, each product is a lesson in flavor.  

Come for the quality. Stay for the connection. This is farm-to-table, rooted in East Riding—and waiting for you.

name: Shaw J & Son
description:
**Shaw J & Son: A Century of Fresh, Honest Flavour in the Heart of Lincolnshire**  

For over 120 years, Shaw J & Son has been the trusted name for fresh, local produce in Lincolnshire. Nestled on Yarburgh Road near the historic village of Alvingham, our family farm shop carries forward a legacy of quality—rooted in hard work, community, and the simple joy of good food.  

It began in 1902, when Great Grandfather Charles chose this land to build his market gardening business. Three generations later, though the fields have changed, our commitment hasn’t: we still source the finest seasonal produce, just as he did. Today, our farm shop is a celebration of Lincolnshire’s bounty—crisp fruits, vibrant vegetables, and artisanal goods, all handpicked for flavour and freshness.  

Step inside, and you’ll taste the difference. Our shelves are stocked with the best local suppliers, from sun-ripened strawberries to earthy heritage potatoes. Voted Loose Fruit & Veg Champions of Lincolnshire by our community, we take pride in offering food that’s grown with care, not chemicals. The shop itself is a welcoming space—a blend of rustic charm and modern simplicity, where every visit feels like coming home.  

Whether you’re a local or passing through, Shaw J & Son invites you to slow down, savour, and support real farming. Open year-round, our doors are always ready with a warm welcome and something delicious. Come taste the tradition.  

*Find us at Buxton House, Yarburgh Road—where great food and family heritage meet.*

**Discover the Art of Honest Farming at Herd & Hive Ltd**  

Nestled in the rolling hills of Lancashire, just off Moss Houses Road, Herd & Hive Ltd is more than a farm—it’s a celebration of tradition, quality, and the simple joy of fresh, local produce. For generations, this family-run haven has been a cornerstone of Yorkshire and Lancashire, where the rhythms of the land shape everything they do.  

Step into their charming farm shop, and you’ll find shelves lined with the finest seasonal offerings—each item a testament to their commitment to authenticity. From creamy goat’s milk soap, crafted using centuries-old methods, to vibrant fruits, vegetables, and artisanal goods, every product tells a story of care and connection. This is farm-to-table at its purest: no shortcuts, just honest flavor.  

What sets Herd & Hive apart isn’t just what they sell, but how they welcome you. The farm shop feels like a hidden gem—a place where locals and visitors alike gather to savor the best of Lancashire’s bounty. Whether you’re stocking up for the week or searching for a unique gift, the warmth of the staff and the quality of their offerings make every visit memorable.  

Come for the fresh, seasonal produce. Stay for the sense of community. Herd & Hive Ltd invites you to slow down, taste the difference, and take home a piece of Lancashire’s rich agricultural heritage. The farm shop is open now—your table deserves nothing less.
